Metadata: Chitosan oligomers from "Fusarium solani"/pea interactions, chitinase/B-​glucanase digestion of sporelings and from fungal wall chitin actively inhibit fungal growth and enhance disease resistance

Chitosan is a component of the fungal walls of many fungi, including "Fusarium solani." Chitosan has been implicated as a regulatory component in the "Pisum sativum-​Fusarium solani" host-pathogen interaction. This study examined the biological activity and actual polymer sizes of chitosan produced from the plant-fungus interaction or produced from the deacetylation of chitin synthesized by the pathogen. A biologically active chitosan oligomer (heptamer or larger) was recovered from the fungi.
